items.title: Meeting over between US official and Ghislane  Maxwell, who will 'welcome any relief', lawyer says
items.description: When asked about giving Maxwell clemency, the president said he was allowed to do so, but had "not thought" about it.

items.title: 220 MPs call for Starmer to recognise Palestinian state
items.description: The PM says recognition of a Palestinian state must be part of a "wider plan" to ensure peace in the region.

items.title: Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
items.description: Israel faces increasing pressure from Western allies to lift restrictions into the flow of aid into Gaza.

items.title: Former Congolese president on trial for treason
items.description: Joseph Kabila denies backing the M23 rebels, who have seized large parts of the mineral-rich east.

items.title: French pledge to recognise Palestine is a gamble - so will Starmer follow suit?
items.description: The prime minister is facing pressure at home and abroad to recognise a Palestinian state.
